title: KUWTK: Kris Jenner is afraid daughter Khloe Kardashian is going to 'come for her' over apparent lie
text:
This family has seen its fair share of drama and high jinks, and more of same is on the way.

In a sneak peek of Sunday’s new episode of E!'s Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Khloe Kardashian is mad at mom Kris Jenner for avoiding her over an apparent deception unearthed in Khloe's ex Lamar Odom's new memoir.

In the clip, Khloe, 35, tells Scott Disick that she's 'been looking for mom forever.'

What's up mom? In a sneak peek of Sunday’s new episode of E!'s Keeping Up With The Kardashians, Khloe Kardashian is mad at mom Kris Jenner for avoiding her

'She’s literally avoiding me,' she continues, as the pair hang in the kitchen.

Eventually, she gets Disick to admit that momager Jenner, 63, is avoiding her daughter over fear of a confrontation.

'She's scared that you're going to confront her,' he tells Khloe. 'She’s like, "I don’t want to see Khloe because I don’t want to have the conversation."'

While Khloe previously stated that details in the memoir reveal an alleged lie on the part of her mother, she does not directly refer to it in the episode — Scott refers to it only as 'that SoulCycle thing.'

Owning up: Eventually, Khloe gets Scott Disick to admit that momager Jenner is avoiding her daughter over fear of a confrontation regarding a lie unearthed in Lamar Odom's new memoir

Khloe is incredulous in the clip, and insists that she is over it — she reveals that she's more annoyed about the fact that Kris is avoiding her in the first place.

It turns out that the 'SoulCycle thing' is in connection to a 2015 incident Odom discusses in his book — and one that he has already publicly regretted including in the memoir.

Allegedly, during the last throes of Khloe's troubled marriage to Lamar, Kris called the troubled athlete up without her daughter's knowledge or approval, and told him where Khloe would be the next morning — on her way to a SoulCycle class — so that he could track her down and have words with her.

Sure enough, there she was at the appointed place and time — along with a whole crowd of cameras and paparazzi.

In spite of the obvious deception that was apparent in the incident, now almost five years later Khloe has chosen to no longer focus on it.

'First of all, it’s 600 years ago. I don’t give a s—,' she tells Scott in the new KUWTK preview. 'I’m more annoyed [she’s not talking to me]. Literally, I would have just given her a hard time.'

'She literally thinks you’re going to like, "come for her," is her wording,' says Disick.

'Guess what?' Kardashian claps back. 'I am.'

Scared mama: 'She literally thinks you’re going to like, "come for her," is her wording,' says Disick

In the confessional segment, Kardashian and Disick start scheming to get Kris to run in to her daughter without her knowledge.

'I could say I'm sick,' Scott suggests slyly. 'She's always come over if I say I'm sick.'

'We lure her in, and you could just come out of another door,' he continues.

Kardashian seems into the plan, to a point.

'I'm not gonna, like, jump her,' Khloe maintains.

Not that mad: Khloe is incredulous in the clip, and insists that she is over it; seen here in an Instagram post from Florida on Friday

Kardashian wed Odom, 39, in September of 2009 — just one month after meeting.

After a first split in 2013 as a result of the basketball star's infidelity and drug addiction problems, they finally, officially divorced in 2016, after Lamar recovered from a near-fatal drug overdose.

In Odom’s memoir, which was published this spring, he tells a frank account of his troubles and owns up to why his relationship with Khloe ultimately failed.

In another clip for the new KUWTK episode, Khloe admits that she misses her ex Lamar 'all the time' and is open to meeting with him in person, but 'I don’t want to mislead him in any way.'

Keeping Up With The Kardashians airs Sundays at 9pm on E!
